nodes.bodyText: the DialogUtil class supports passing null for a click action, I think that would be better than taking up 3 lines

the DialogUtil class supports passing null for a click action, I think that would be better than taking up 3 lines

Got it!

uploadItem.setImageQuality(ImageUtils.IMAGE_KEEP); should be on a separate line to the { unless it is a statement lambda ie one method call or value
For example deleteThisPicture(); below can have the braces and colon removed to become a statement lambda.
It can also go further and become a method reference ::deleteThisPicture because the input parameters () are the same as the parameter for the method deleteThisPicture()
Using the elipsis character is recommended by lint but it is not a part of this ticket, probably something we have to discuss with Translatewiki
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -552,7 +552,7 @@ Upload your first media by tapping on the add button.</string>
   <string name="exif_tag_name_software">Software</string>
 
   <string name="share_text">Upload photos to Wikimedia Commons directly from your phone. Download the Commons App now: %1$s</string>
-  <string name="share_via">Share app via...</string>
+  <string name="share_via">Share app via…</string>

nodes.bodyText: That was a mistake on my end! I was trying to search for what a string Id meant in the xml file, and realized that I had removed something, so I ctrl+z. I didn’t think git would reflect it since I did not refactor anything.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -552,7 +552,7 @@ Upload your first media by tapping on the add button.</string>
   <string name="exif_tag_name_software">Software</string>
 
   <string name="share_text">Upload photos to Wikimedia Commons directly from your phone. Download the Commons App now: %1$s</string>
-  <string name="share_via">Share app via...</string>
+  <string name="share_via">Share app via…</string>

nodes.bodyText:
Well, we see the difference just because Git has detected it. So, it would be nice if you could revert it. You could use the following suggestion, if you wish:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              <string name="share_via">Share app via…</string>
          
          
            
              <string name="share_via">Share app via...</string>
          
      
    
    
  

FYI: Translatewiki handles the ellipisis character just fine. Here's an example of a string from another app which contains the ellipsis character and is translated appropriately: https://translatewiki.net/wiki/Wikimedia:Wikipedia-android-strings-login_in_progress_dialog_message/en
